metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1405 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
libclamav in ClamAV (aka Clam AntiVirus), as used in Advanced MalwareProtection (AMP) on Cisco Email Security Appliance (ESA) devices before9.7.0-125 and Web Security Appliance (WSA) devices before 9.0.1-135 and9.1.x before 9.1.1-041, allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (AMP process restart) via a crafted document, aka Bug IDsCSCuv78533 and CSCuw60503.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1405` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-base - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamdscan - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libclamav9 - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: clamav package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
